FuncDef: The reset port-queue statistics on-board command deletes port queue statistics on an interface of a motherboard, including the number of packets and bytes that the interface forwards or drops.
CLIs: reset port-queue statistics interface { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } [ <cos-value> ] outbound [ on-board ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the flow queue priority.
The value is an enumerated type and can be cs7, cs6, ef, af4, af3, af2, af1, or be.

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset port-queue statistics interface GigabitEthernet1/0/0 af1 outbound on-board
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To delete port queue statistics on an interface of a motherboard, including the number of packets and bytes that the interface forwards or drops, run the reset port-queue statistics on-board command. This command applies to the LPUF-120 and LPUF-240.
